clues.text: "Moonstruck" star whose mother, Georgia Holt, co-wrote a book about "Star Mothers"
She wrote 2 autobiographies: "Bubbles" & "Beverly"
"Masterpiece Theatre" host who wrote "America" & "America Observed"
Her book "Survivor" begins where "Mommie Dearest" left off
"Golden Girl" who penned "If I Knew Then What I Know Now... So What?"
Picasso painted lots of gloomy paintings from 1901-04, mostly in shades of this color
Combining her love of flowers & the desert, she painted "Mule's Skull with Pink Poinsettias" in 1937
This artist, who lived in Arlington, Vermont, put himself in about 25 of his own works
Renoir was born in this French city known for porcelain, & at age 13 he was a porcelain decorator
Last name of the American artist who had artistic sons named Titian, Raphaelle & Rembrandt
"Joshua fit the Battle of Jericho, and" these "came tumblin' down"
Cole Porter wrote, "Why, oh why do I love" this city?  "Because my love is near"
In "Paint Your Wagon", Julio complains, "I talk to the trees, but they don't" do this
On his 1988 album "Even Worse" this pop parodist sang "Stuck In A Closet (With Vanna White)"
A song in "Porgy & Bess" is titled "There's A Boat Dat's Leavin' Soon For" this city
In 1977 The New York Times started this rival to People magazine
"Guideposts" magazine, which features stories of faith, was founded in 1945 by this positive thinking minister
Tho its London casinos earned 63% of this magazine co.'s profits in 1980, they were sold in 1981
After 31 years as editor of Saturday Review, he resigned in 1971 only to return as publisher in 1973
After 23 years as fashion editor of Harper's Bazaar, she moved over to Vogue in 1963
He's the bishop of Rome
About 610 A.D. the angel Gabriel appeared to him while he was praying on Mount Hira
The number of theses, or proposals, that Martin Luther nailed to the door of Castle Church
Briefly a baptist & later a non-denominational Christian, he founded R.I. as a center of religious liberty
Roman Catholic saint who wrote "The City of God"
Since Puritan women didn't cook on Sunday, they baked these the night before, earning Boston its nickname
This president's grandfather served 2 terms as Boston's mayor in the early 1900s
From the name of the highest Hindu caste, it can refer to powerful, wealthy Boston families
An elegant section of Boston, or a short-lived TV show about a family who lived there
You'll see colonial cemeteries, churches & various houses if you take this historic "trail"

rounds.comments: (Alex: All of the correct responses will be about women.)

clues.text: Chiang Ch'ing got into a lot of trouble in the late 1970s for hanging out with this "Gang"
3 days before her execution as a spy, she wrote to Pres. Eisenhower asking for clemency
In 1969 this 21-year-old member of Parliament from N. Ireland was convicted of inciting to riot
The 1st president of Int'l Planned Parenthood, she came from a family of 11 children
Named to this post by FDR, Frances Perkins was the 1st woman to hold a position in the cabinet
It can be a small chest to hold a couple of tablets or a big ship to hold at least 2 of every animal
At the Backstage in Culver City, Glynis can pour you one of these containing several servings of beer
Oh, Archie! It's a large bin for coal or an underground chamber for gunners
The container called a "vial" can also contain this pair of letters instead of the "v"
(Jimmy holds the clue.) It's the container I'm holding. Ah, there's my Renoir!
She lived with a septet of men who didn't even get names until 1937
Call Joan Rivers! It's all about foot fashion & royalty for this girl also known as Cendrillon
This indecisive girl commits home invasion, then deal with ursine land owners
A house made of food turns into a house of horror when 2 kids bake a witch in this "Grimm" tale
Oops! Visiting this long-tressed gal, the prince is blinded in a fall
The word Oklahoma comes from a Choctaw expression meaning "people of" this color
The Israelites miraculously escaped across this body of water in Exodus 14
It was the last of Krzysztof Kieslowski's 3 films whose titles matched the 3 colors in the French flag
To an Aussie, a "bluey" is a woman with this color hair
In a 15th century English war, a rose of this color represented the House of York

rounds.comments: (Alex: Since this is the last show of our 18th season, we're going to have...)

clues.text: The fifth season finale of this Chris Carter series set up viewers for the first feature film
On the season finale of this show in 1996, a wounded Sully had to deliver Mike's baby
The season finale of this FOX series on May 22, 1995 had a plot to blow up the title apartment complex
In the sixth season finale of this "Star Trek" series Jadzia Dax died...well, Jadzia died...it's hard to explain
For its fifth season finale in May 1999 Mandy Patinkin returned as Dr. Jeffrey Geiger
The Old Absinthe House has been on Bourbon St. in this city for so long that even Oscar Wilde used to drink there
Stars shoot by when you ride this roller coaster-in-the-dark that made its Disney World debut in 1975
Poppy-shaped juglets that may have once held opium await us at this big 5th Ave. art museum's new Cypriot Galleries
Yee-haw! The Snake River Stampede grew out of a harvest festival held in Nampa in this state in 1911
"O" yes, more than 2 million spectators have thrilled to Cirque du Soleil's "O" show at this Las Vegas hotel

rounds.text: It's the world's longest river whose outflow is into an entirely inland body of water
